instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spins for 1 second and goes off.
threads.message:
Hi, I have macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> when it came it was dead after putting the power cable and search through thermal camera i found that <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> were overheating so i have replaced with with another one and the board start turning on but the fan spins for 1 second then switches off.

All the points gives normal values when it turns on for 1 second.

L7320 and L7310: try to display 1.78v and goes off straight away.
L7630: 1.05v
L7430:1.119 v

I have replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> , <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> ,<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>,<CHIP>U7400</CHIP>,<CHIP>U7200</CHIP>,<CHIP>U5620</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7820</CHIP>  and SMC but the machine still does the same

Could it be CPU that has issue?

I have tried to power on with SMC bypass but it doesnt power on at all

Generally when you plug the charger in it spins twice for 1 second each time and stays off. If you press power button afterwards  it does the same 2 times for 1 second and goes off

Device is not liquid damaged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spins for 1 second and goes off.
threads.message:
Apart of <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> (which overheats), what was the reason to change the other chips?

Can you catch any pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
